content.body: AI comments are annoying. They're verbose and usually not very useful. Latest I suspect: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/5867#issuecomment-3720854771
Footnotes! We finally have a use case~ Wake up Jake!
Does anybody know why firefox do a sort of implicit pointer-capture for text controls?

* Does anybody know why firefox do a sort of implicit pointer-capture for text controls?
Edit: never mind, I get it now.

Does anybody know why firefox do a sort of implicit pointer-capture for text controls?

content.body: So til that for html `<a> or <area>` if you toString() them you get their href value. Is that considered esoteric legacy stuff or fair game to copy elsewhere?
